description: Artists from around the world return to the streets of Ann Arbor, Michigan July 21-24th for one of the nation's best art fairs. #AnnArborArtFair
name: The 2016 Ann Arbor Art Fair

description: Premier artists from around the country come to the District and mix with our local businesses for four days of art fair excitement.
name: State Street Art Fair

description:
It's Summer Beer Fest time, and the fun doesn't stop when Riverside Park shuts down for the evening! Six brews will be pouring ALL DAY at Ypsi's Tap Room, including an exclusive release of Eclipser Chestnut Lager! Come hang out -- the brewers and your favorite beer slingers will be at Tap Room post-festival to answer all your lager questions and throw you some swag! 

Beer list: 
Verano Mexican-style Amber Lager
Gulo Gulo India Pale Lager
Faustian Baltic Porter
**FIRST RELEASE OF SEASON** Eclipser Chestnut Lager
Cereza Rey Cherry Cream Stout Lager
West Side Wheat American Wheat Lager
name: Tap Takeover - Tap Room in Ypsi!

description:
Unwind from the workweek and flex your creative muscles while enjoying our exclusive Pointless craft beers. 

We will provide the writing and drawing prompts, doodle starters, colored pencils and markers, you provide your awesome self and your desire to relax and have fun.

Fridays, 3-7pm at Pointless Brewery & Theatre. 3014 Packard Road, Ann Arbor.
name: Drink & Draw / Imbibe & Inscribe

description:
Stop in to UMMA to enjoy special exhibitions, live music featuring Naked Ace, and engaging activities at this special Art Fair edition of Fridays After 5! With all of UMMA's galleries remaining open until 8 p.m., this exciting series provides an interactive atmosphere for all audiences. While you're here, browse the UMMA Store for a wide variety of specialty items. The Museum is always free.

UMMA Fridays After 5 are generously supported by Comerica Bank and the State Street District. The media sponsor for Fridays After 5 is Michigan Radio.
name: Fridays After 5 – Special Art Fair Edition

description:
Join us on FRIDAY, JULY 22 (6 - 9PM) for a new evening of unusual experiences at the Ann Arbor Art Center.

Free and open to the public.

What is POP•IN?

Injecting the Art Center with a spirit of pop-up culture and by collaborating with diverse artists, we aim to attract intrepid young adults looking to explore and be excited by a city. 

Community members who attend POP•IN will be immersed in unusual, accessible experiences, whether they planned to attend the event or wandered in off the street.

While POP•IN is free, we will allow visitors to buy tickets to reserve seating for performances, and make things they can take home.

Join us on Friday, July 22 and experience a new POP•IN! 

And don't forget POP·OFF! POP·IN's official after party...

ALL ATTENDEES receive coupons for discounts and freebies at several participating bars/restaurants within a block of the Art Center.

Official page: http://www.annarborartcenter.org/events/popin/
-------------------
Sponsored by 
Michigan Council for Arts and Cultural Affairs & PNC

#POPIN
name: Pop•In

description:
Robin Gaines is the author of the novel-in-stories, Invincible Summers, forthcoming in May 2016 from ELJ Publications. Her short stories and essays can be found in Slice, Crack the Spine, Spindrift, Oasis: A Literary Magazine, Willard & Maple, The Homestead Review, Current Magazine, and Porcupine Literary Arts Magazine.

Robin is a member of the Detroit Working Writers and the Metro Detroit Book & Author Society. Born in Detroit, she lives half the year outside of Ann Arbor and the other half on a lake in Petoskey, Michigan.
name: Robin Gaines - Michigan Author

description:
These shows are completely improvised, and star an impressive cast of experienced local improvisers, including our resident company The League of Pointless Improvisers.

Group 1: "Improv Utopia"

Group 2: "Improv Utopia"

Group 3: "The League of Pointless Improvisers" starring Arthur Brannon, Maggie O'Reilly, Emily Engelhart, Chris Moody, and Gary Lehman
name: Pointless Improv with Improv Utopia

description:

18+
$5

Electronic Live Music - Dance, Jazz, Deep House. Live Guitar and Vocals. Based in Michigan.

description:
Laugh as our League tackles long form improv with their hilarious skills. Gasp as they traverse styles with ease. Be amazed as they improvise without a net.

No two shows are the same!

Starring Arthur Brannon, Maggie O'Reilly, Emily Engelhart, Chris Moody, and Gary Lehman
name: A Pointless Display of Improvised Feats
